One man's terrorist is another man's freedom fighter.
 
 

 This claim is often thoughtlessly repeated and it doesn't survive analysis. 
 
 Freedom is an end and terrorism is a means. To describe someone as a terrorist is to say something about his policy or tactics - i.e. the means he employs for achieving his ends. But to describe someone merely as a freedom fighter is to say nothing about how he wishes to achieve his ends (he might resort to peaceful means or he might not). It follows that one and the same individual can be both a terrorist and a freedom fighter. In other words, one and the same person can employ terror as his means while having freedom as his end. 
 
 So terror is a means not an end, and there is an objective fact of the matter whether a so-called combatant is a terrorist or not.
